TextView.android:text: 1)In the first 10 overs of a cricket game, the run rate was only 3.2. What should be the run rate in the remaining 40 overs to reach the target of 282 runs?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Explanation: Required run rate = (282-(3.2x 10)/40) = 250/40 = 6.25
2)A grocer has a sale of Rs. 6435, Rs. 6927, Rs. 6855, Rs. 7230 and Rs. 6562 for 5 consecutive months. How much sale must he have in the sixth month so that he gets an average sale of Rs. 6500?
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 Explanation: Total sale for 5 months = Rs. (6435 + 6927 + 6855 + 7230 + 6562) = Rs. 34009. 
 So, Required sale = Rs. [ (6500 x 6) - 34009 ] 
 =Rs. (39000 - 34009) 
 =Rs. 4991.
3)The average of 20 numbers is zero. Of them, at the most, how many may be greater than zer:
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 Explanation: Average of 20 numbers = 0. 
 So,Sum of 20 numbers (0 x 20) = 0. 
 It is quite possible that 19 of these numbers may be positive and if their sum is a then 20th number is (-a).
4)The average weight of 8 person's increases by 2.5 kg when a new person comes in place of one of them weighing 65 kg. What might be the weight of the new person?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Explanation: Total weight increased = (8 x 2.5) kg = 20 kg. \n Weight of new person = (65 + 20) kg = 85 kg.
5)The average monthly income of P and Q is Rs. 5050. The average monthly income of Q and R is Rs. 6250 and the average monthly income of P and R is Rs. 5200. The monthly income of P is:
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Explanation: 
 Let P, Q and R represent their respective monthly incomes. Then, we have: 
 P + Q = (5050 x 2) = 10100 .... (i) 
 Q + R = (6250 x 2) = 12500 .... (ii) 
 P + R = (5200 x 2) = 10400 .... (iii) 
 Adding (i), (ii) and (iii), we get: 2(P + Q + R) = 33000 or P + Q + R = 16500 .... (iv) 
 Subtracting (ii) from (iv), we get P = 4000. 
 So,P's monthly income = Rs. 4000.
6)The average age of husband, wife and their child 3 years ago was 27 years and that of wife and the child 5 years ago was 20 years. The present age of the husband is:
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Explanation: 
 Sum of the present ages of husband, wife and child = (27 x 3 + 3 x 3) years = 90 years. 
 Sum of the present ages of wife and child = (20 x 2 + 5 x 2) years = 50 years. 
 So, Husband's present age = (90 - 50) years = 40 years.
7)A car owner buys petrol at Rs.7.50, Rs. 8 and Rs. 8.50 per litre for three successive years. What approximately is the average cost per litre of petrol if he spends Rs. 4000 each year?
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 Explanation: 
 Total quantity of petrol 
 consumed in 3 years = (4000/7.5 +4000/8+4000/8.50) litres 
 = 4000(2/15+1/8+2/17)litres 
 =(76700/51)litres 
 Total amount spent = Rs. (3 x 4000) = Rs. 12000. 
 So, Average cost = Rs(12000 x 51/76700) 
 = Rs 6120/767 = Rs7.98
8)The average weight of A, B and C is 45 kg. If the average weight of A and B be 40 kg and that of B and C be 43 kg, then the weight of B is:
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 Explanation: 
 Let A, B, C represent their respective weights. Then, we have: 
 A + B + C = (45 x 3) = 135 .... (i) 
 A + B = (40 x 2) = 80 .... (ii) 
 B + C = (43 x 2) = 86 ....(iii)

 Adding (ii) and (iii), we get: A + 2B + C = 166 .... (iv) 
 Subtracting (i) from (iv), we get : B = 31. 
 So,B's weight = 31 kg.
9)The average weight of 16 boys in a class is 50.25 kg and that of the remaining 8 boys is 45.15 kg. Find the average weights of all the boys in the class.
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 Explanation: 
 Required Average = (50.25 x 16 + 45.15 x 8/16+8) 
 =(804 + 361.20/24) 
 =1165.24/24 
 =48.55
10)If the average marks of three batches of 55, 60 and 45 students respectively is 50, 55, 60, then the average marks of all the students is:
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Explanation: 
 Required Average = (55 x 50 + 60 x 55 + 45 x 60/55 + 60 + 45) 
 = (2750 + 3300 + 2700/160) 
 = 8750/160 
 = 54.68
11)The average age of P, Q, R and S is 30 years. How old is R? \n I.The sum of ages of P and R is 60 years. \n II.S is 10 years younger than R.

RadioButton.android:text: A)I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
B)II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
C)Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
D)Both I and II are not sufficient to answer

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 P + Q + R + S = (30 x 4) So,P + Q + R + S = 120 .... (i) 
 I. P + R = 60 .... (ii) 
 II. S = (R - 10) .... (iii) 
 From (i), (ii) and (iii), we cannot find R. 
 Correct answer is (D)

12)How many candidates were interviewed everyday by the panel A out of the three panels A, B and C? I.The three panels on average interview 15 candidates every day. \n II.Out of a total of 45 candidates interviewed everyday by the three panels, the number of candidates interviewed by panel A is more by 2 than the candidates interviewed by panel c and is more by 1 than the candidates interviewed by panel B.

RadioButton.android:text: A)I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
B)II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
C)Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
D)Both I and II are not sufficient to answer

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 I. Total candidates interviewed by 3 panels = (15 x 3) = 45. 
 II. Let x candidates be interviewed by C. 
 Number of candidates interviewed by A = (x + 2). 
 Number of candidates interviewed by B = (x + 1). 
 So,x + (x + 2) + (x + 1) = 45 
 3x = 42 
 x = 14 
 Hence, the correct answer is (B).

13)What is the average age of children in the class? I.The age of the teacher is as many years as the number of children. \n II.Average age is increased by 1 year if the teacher's age is also included.

RadioButton.android:text: A)I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
B)II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
C)Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
D)Both I and II are not sufficient to answer

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 Let there be x children. 
 I gives, age of teacher = x years. 
 II gives, average age of (x + 1) persons = (x + 1) years. 
 Teacher's age = (x + 1) (x + 1) - x^2 = (x^2 + 1 + 2x) - x^2 = (1 + 2x) 
 Thus, teacher's age cannot be obtained. 
 So,Correct answer is (D)

14)How many marks did Tarun secure in English? I.The average mark obtained by Tarun in four subjects including English is 60. \n II.The total marks obtained by him in English and Mathematics together are 170. \n III.The total marks obtained by him in Mathematics and Science together are 180.
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 I gives, total marks in 4 subjects = (60 x 4) = 240. 
 II gives, E + M = 170 
 III gives, M + S = 180. 
 Thus, none of (A), (B), (C), (D) is true. 
 Correct answer is (A).

15)In a cricket team, the average age of eleven players in 28 years. What is the age of the captain? 
 I.The captain is eleven years older than the youngest player. 
 II.The average age of 10 players, other than the captain is 27.3 years. 
 III.Leaving aside the captain and the youngest player, the average ages of three groups of three players each are 25 years, 28 years and 30 years respectively.

RadioButton.android:text: C)II only or I and III only

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 Total age of 11 players = (28 x 11) years = 308 years. 
 I. C = Y + 11 So, C - Y = 11 .... (i) 
 II. Total age of 10 players (excluding captain) = (27.3 x 10) years = 273 years. 
 So,Age of captain = (308 - 273) years = 35 years. 
 Thus, C = 35. .... (ii) 
 From (i) and (ii), we get Y = 24

 III. Total age of 9 players = [ (25 x 3) + (28 x 3) + (30 x 3)] years = 249 years. 
 C + Y = (308 - 249) = 59 .... (iii) 
 From (i) and (iii), we get C = 35. 
 Thus, II alone gives the answer.
 Also, I and III together give the answer. 
 Correct answer is (C).
16)The average weight of A, B and C is 45 kg. If the average weight of A and B be 40 kg and that of B and C be 43 kg, then the weight of B is:
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 Let A, B, C represent their respective weights. Then, we have: 
 A + B + C = (45 x 3) = 135 .... (i) 
 A + B = (40 x 2) = 80 .... (ii) 
 B + C = (43 x 2) = 86 ....(iii) 
 Adding (ii) and (iii), we get: A + 2B + C = 166 .... (iv) 
 Subtracting (i) from (iv), we get : B = 31. 
 B's weight = 31 kg.
17) The average weight of 16 boys in a class is 50.25 kg and that of the remaining 8 boys is 45.15 kg. Find the average weights of all the boys in the class.
View Answer
18)A library has an average of 510 visitors on Sundays and 240 on other days. The average number of visitors per day in a month of 30 days beginning with a Sunday is:
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 Since the month begins with a Sunday, to there will be five Sundays in the month. 
 Required average = (510 x 5 + 240 x 25/30) 
 =8550/30 
 =285
19)If the average marks of three batches of 55, 60 and 45 students respectively is 50, 55, 60, then the average marks of all the students is:
View Answer
20) A pupil's marks were wrongly entered as 83 instead of 63. Due to that the average marks for the class got increased by half (1/2). The number of pupils in the class is:
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 Let there be x pupils in the class. 
 Total increase in marks = (y x 1/2) = y/2 
 So, y/2=(83-63) so,y/2=20 , so y=40
